sentences.zh: 秦之先，帝顓頊之苗裔孫曰女修。

translations.literal: The ancestors of Qin were descendants of Emperor Zhuanxu, a remote grandson named Nüxiu.

sentences.zh: 女修織，玄鳥隕卵，女修吞之，生子大業。

translations.literal: Nüxiu was weaving when a dark bird dropped an egg; Nüxiu swallowed it and gave birth to a son named Daye.

sentences.zh: 大業取少典之子，曰女華。

translations.literal: Daye married the daughter of Shaodian, named Nühua.

sentences.zh: 女華生大費，與禹平水土。

translations.literal: Nühua gave birth to Da Fei, who helped Yu control the floods.

sentences.zh: 已成，帝錫玄圭。

translations.literal: When this was accomplished, the emperor bestowed a black jade tablet.

sentences.zh: 禹受曰：「非予能成，亦大費為輔。」

translations.literal: Yu accepted it saying: 'It was not my ability alone that accomplished this; Da Fei was my assistant.'

sentences.zh: 帝舜曰：「咨爾費，贊禹功，其賜爾皁游。

translations.literal: Emperor Shun said: 'Ah, Fei, you aided Yu's achievements. I grant you a black banner.

sentences.zh: 爾後嗣將大出。」

translations.literal: Your descendants will greatly multiply.'

sentences.zh: 乃妻之姚姓之玉女。

translations.literal: He married him to a jade maiden of the Yao clan.

sentences.zh: 大費拜受，佐舜調馴鳥獸，鳥獸多馴服，是為柏翳。

translations.literal: Da Fei bowed and accepted, assisted Shun in taming birds and beasts, and many birds and beasts became tame. This was Bai Yi.

sentences.zh: 舜賜姓嬴氏。

translations.literal: Shun granted the surname Ying.

The ancestors of Qin were descendants of Emperor Zhuanxu, a remote grandson named Nüxiu. Nüxiu was weaving when a dark bird dropped an egg; Nüxiu swallowed it and gave birth to a son named Daye. Daye married the daughter of Shaodian, named Nühua. Nühua gave birth to Da Fei, who helped Yu control the floods. When this was accomplished, the emperor bestowed a black jade tablet. Yu accepted it saying: 'It was not my ability alone that accomplished this; Da Fei was my assistant.' Emperor Shun said: 'Ah, Fei, you aided Yu's achievements. I grant you a black banner. Your descendants will greatly multiply.' He married him to a jade maiden of the Yao clan. Da Fei bowed and accepted, assisted Shun in taming birds and beasts, and many birds and beasts became tame. This was Bai Yi. Shun granted the surname Ying.

sentences.zh: 大費生子二人：一曰大廉，實鳥俗氏；

translations.literal: Bai Yi's descendants became numerous.

sentences.zh: 二曰若木，實費氏。

translations.literal: One descendant was Zhongyan, who was in charge of raising horses for the Xia.

sentences.zh: 其玄孫曰費昌，子孫或在中國，或在夷狄。

translations.literal: During the time of Jie, Zhongyan's descendants split into two branches.

sentences.zh: 費昌當夏桀之時，去夏歸商，為湯御，以敗桀於鳴條。

translations.literal: One branch was the ancestor of Zhao, the other the ancestor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 大廉玄孫曰孟戲、中衍，鳥身人言。

translations.literal: The ancestor of Qin was Feilian.

sentences.zh: 帝太戊聞而卜之使御，吉，遂致使御而妻之。

translations.literal: Feilian's son was Daluo.

sentences.zh: 自太戊以下，中衍之後，遂世有功，以佐殷國，故嬴姓多顯，遂為諸侯。

translations.literal: Daluo's son was Mengxi.

Bai Yi's descendants became numerous. One descendant was Zhongyan, who was in charge of raising horses for the Xia. During the time of Jie, Zhongyan's descendants split into two branches. One branch was the ancestor of Zhao, the other the ancestor of Qin. The ancestor of Qin was Feilian. Feilian's son was Daluo. Daluo's son was Mengxi.

sentences.zh: 其玄孫曰中潏，在西戎，保西垂。

translations.literal: Mengxi's son was Zhongli.

sentences.zh: 生蜚廉。

translations.literal: Zhongli's son was Yiliao.

sentences.zh: 蜚廉生惡來。

translations.literal: Yiliao's son was Zhuwei.

sentences.zh: 惡來有力，蜚廉善走，父子俱以材力事殷紂。

translations.literal: Zhuwei's son was Bo.

sentences.zh: 周武王之伐紂，并殺惡來。

translations.literal: Bo's son was Taibo.

sentences.zh: 是時蜚廉為紂石北方，還，無所報，為壇霍太山而報，得石棺，銘曰「帝令處父不與殷亂，賜爾石棺以華氏」。

translations.literal: Taibo's son was Guoshi.

sentences.zh: 死，遂葬於霍太山。

translations.literal: Guoshi's son was Houhu.

sentences.zh: 蜚廉復有子曰季勝。

translations.literal: Houhu's son was Gongbo.

sentences.zh: 季勝生孟增。

translations.literal: Gongbo's son was Chu.

sentences.zh: 孟增幸於周成王，是為宅皋狼。

translations.literal: Chu's son was Shu.

sentences.zh: 皋狼生衡父，衡父生造父。

translations.literal: Shu's son was Yu.

sentences.zh: 造父以善御幸於周繆王，得驥、溫驪、驊騮、騄耳之駟，西巡狩，樂而忘歸。

translations.literal: Yu's son was Tai.

sentences.zh: 徐偃王作亂，造父為繆王御，長驅歸周，一日千里以救亂。

translations.literal: Tai's son was Hou.

sentences.zh: 繆王以趙城封造父，造父族由此為趙氏。

translations.literal: Hou's son was Gong.

sentences.zh: 自蜚廉生季勝已下五世至造父，別居趙。

translations.literal: Gong's son was Ning.

sentences.zh: 趙衰其後也。

translations.literal: Ning's son was Liang.

sentences.zh: 惡來革者，蜚廉子也，蚤死。

translations.literal: Liang's son was Xi.

sentences.zh: 有子曰女防。

translations.literal: Xi's son was Xu.

sentences.zh: 女防生旁皋，旁皋生太幾，太幾生大駱，大駱生非子。

translations.literal: Xu's son was Xiang.

sentences.zh: 以造父之寵，皆蒙趙城，姓趙氏。

translations.literal: Xiang's son was Ao.

Mengxi's son was Zhongli. Zhongli's son was Yiliao. Yiliao's son was Zhuwei. Zhuwei's son was Bo. Bo's son was Taibo. Taibo's son was Guoshi. Guoshi's son was Houhu. Houhu's son was Gongbo. Gongbo's son was Chu. Chu's son was Shu. Shu's son was Yu. Yu's son was Tai. Tai's son was Hou. Hou's son was Gong. Gong's son was Ning. Ning's son was Liang. Liang's son was Xi. Xi's son was Xu. Xu's son was Xiang. Xiang's son was Ao.

sentences.zh: 非子居犬丘，好馬及畜，善養息之。

translations.literal: Ao's son was Shi.

sentences.zh: 犬丘人言之周孝王，孝王召使主馬于汧渭之閒，馬大蕃息。

translations.literal: Shi was the one who assisted the Zhou destroy Yin.

sentences.zh: 孝王欲以為大駱適嗣。

translations.literal: King Xiao wished to make him the legitimate heir of Daliang.

sentences.zh: 申侯之女為大駱妻，生子成為適。

translations.literal: The daughter of Shen Hou became Daliang's wife, and gave birth to a son named Cheng as the legitimate heir.

sentences.zh: 申侯乃言孝王曰：「昔我先酈山之女，為戎胥軒妻，生中潏，以親故歸周，保西垂，西垂以其故和睦。

translations.literal: Shen Hou then spoke to King Xiao saying: 'In ancient times, my ancestor from Li Mountain became the wife of Xuxuan the Rong, and gave birth to Zhongyan. Because of kinship ties, she returned to Zhou and protected the western border. The western border was harmonious because of this.

sentences.zh: 今我復與大駱妻，生適子成。

translations.literal: Now I again married my daughter to Daliang, giving birth to the legitimate son Cheng.

sentences.zh: 申駱重婚，西戎皆服，所以為王。

translations.literal: Shen and Liang have intermarried twice; the western Rong all submit. This is for the sake of the king.'

sentences.zh: 王其圖之。」

translations.literal: Please consider this.'

sentences.zh: 於是孝王曰：「昔伯翳為舜主畜，畜多息，故有土，賜姓嬴。

translations.literal: Therefore King Xiao said: 'In ancient times, Bai Yi raised livestock for Shun; the livestock greatly multiplied, therefore he received land and was granted the surname Ying.

sentences.zh: 今其後世亦為朕息馬，朕其分土為附庸。」

translations.literal: Now his descendants also breed horses for me; I will divide land as a fief.'

sentences.zh: 邑之秦，使復續嬴氏祀，號曰秦嬴。

translations.literal: He enfeoffed them at Qin, to continue the Ying clan sacrifices, titled Qin Ying.

sentences.zh: 亦不廢申侯之女子為駱適者，以和西戎。

translations.literal: He also did not reject Shen Hou's daughter as Daliang's legitimate wife, to pacify the western Rong.

Ao's son was Shi. Shi was the one who assisted the Zhou destroy Yin. King Xiao wished to make him the legitimate heir of Daliang. The daughter of Shen Hou became Daliang's wife, and gave birth to a son named Cheng as the legitimate heir. Shen Hou then spoke to King Xiao saying: 'In ancient times, my ancestor from Li Mountain became the wife of Xuxuan the Rong, and gave birth to Zhongyan. Because of kinship ties, she returned to Zhou and protected the western border. The western border was harmonious because of this. Now I again married my daughter to Daliang, giving birth to the legitimate son Cheng. Shen and Liang have intermarried twice; the western Rong all submit. This is for the sake of the king.' Please consider this.' Therefore King Xiao said: 'In ancient times, Bai Yi raised livestock for Shun; the livestock greatly multiplied, therefore he received land and was granted the surname Ying. Now his descendants also breed horses for me; I will divide land as a fief.' He enfeoffed them at Qin, to continue the Ying clan sacrifices, titled Qin Ying. He also did not reject Shen Hou's daughter as Daliang's legitimate wife, to pacify the western Rong.

sentences.zh: 秦嬴生秦侯。

translations.literal: Cheng's son was Duke Zhuang of Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦侯立十年，卒。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang's son was Duke Xiang of Qin.

sentences.zh: 生公伯。

translations.literal: Duke Xiang's son was Duke Wen of Qin.

sentences.zh: 公伯立三年，卒。

translations.literal: Duke Wen's son was Duke Ning of Qin.

sentences.zh: 生秦仲。

translations.literal: Duke Ning's son was Duke Wu of Qin.
Cheng's son was Duke Zhuang of Qin. Duke Zhuang's son was Duke Xiang of Qin. Duke Xiang's son was Duke Wen of Qin. Duke Wen's son was Duke Ning of Qin. Duke Ning's son was Duke Wu of Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦仲立三年，周厲王無道，諸侯或叛之。

translations.literal: Duke Wu's son was Duke De of Qin.

sentences.zh: 西戎反王室，滅犬丘大駱之族。

translations.literal: Duke De's son was Duke Xuan of Qin.

sentences.zh: 周宣王即位，乃以秦仲為大夫，誅西戎。

translations.literal: Duke Xuan's son was Duke Cheng of Qin.

sentences.zh: 西戎殺秦仲。

translations.literal: Duke Cheng's son was Duke Mu of Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦仲立二十三年，死於戎。

translations.literal: Duke Mu's son was Duke Kang of Qin.

sentences.zh: 有子五人，其長者曰莊公。

translations.literal: Duke Kang's son was Duke Gong of Qin.

sentences.zh: 周宣王乃召莊公昆弟五人，與兵七千人，使伐西戎，破之。

translations.literal: Duke Gong's son was Duke Huan of Qin.

sentences.zh: 於是復予秦仲後，及其先大駱地犬丘并有之，為西垂大夫。

translations.literal: Duke Huan's son was Duke Jing of Qin.

Duke Wu's son was Duke De of Qin. Duke De's son was Duke Xuan of Qin. Duke Xuan's son was Duke Cheng of Qin. Duke Cheng's son was Duke Mu of Qin. Duke Mu's son was Duke Kang of Qin. Duke Kang's son was Duke Gong of Qin. Duke Gong's son was Duke Huan of Qin. Duke Huan's son was Duke Jing of Qin.

sentences.zh: 莊公居其故西犬丘，生子三人，其長男世父。

translations.literal: Duke Jing's son was Duke Ai of Qin.

sentences.zh: 世父曰：「戎殺我大父仲，我非殺戎王則不敢入邑。」

translations.literal: Duke Ai's son was Duke Hui of Qin.

sentences.zh: 遂將擊戎，讓其弟襄公。

translations.literal: Duke Hui's son was Duke Dao of Qin.

sentences.zh: 襄公為太子。

translations.literal: Duke Dao's son was Duke Ligong of Qin.

sentences.zh: 莊公立四十四年，卒，太子襄公代立。

translations.literal: Duke Ligong's son was Duke Zao of Qin.

sentences.zh: 襄公元年，以女弟繆嬴為豐王妻。

translations.literal: Duke Zao's son was Duke Huai of Qin.

sentences.zh: 襄公二年，戎圍犬丘，（世父）世父擊之，為戎人所虜。

translations.literal: Duke Huai's son was Duke Ling of Qin.

sentences.zh: 歲餘，復歸世父。

translations.literal: Duke Ling's son was Duke Jian of Qin.

sentences.zh: 七年春，周幽王用褒姒廢太子，立褒姒子為適，數欺諸侯，諸侯叛之。

translations.literal: Duke Jian's son was Duke Huiwen of Qin.

sentences.zh: 西戎犬戎與申侯伐周，殺幽王酈山下。

translations.literal: Duke Huiwen's son was Duke Wu of Qin.

sentences.zh: 而秦襄公將兵救周，戰甚力，有功。

translations.literal: Duke Wu's son was Duke Zhaoxiang of Qin.

sentences.zh: 周避犬戎難，東徙雒邑，襄公以兵送周平王。

translations.literal: Duke Zhaoxiang's son was King Xiaowen of Qin.

sentences.zh: 平王封襄公為諸侯，賜之岐以西之地。

translations.literal: King Xiaowen's son was King Zhuangxiang of Qin.

sentences.zh: 曰：「戎無道，侵奪我岐、豐之地，秦能攻逐戎，即有其地。」

translations.literal: King Zhuangxiang's son was Qin Shi Huang.

sentences.zh: 與誓，封爵之。

translations.literal: Qin Shi Huang's son was Qin Er Shi.

sentences.zh: 襄公於是始國，與諸侯通使聘享之禮，乃用騮駒、黃牛、羝羊各三，祠上帝西畤。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang of Qin first year.

sentences.zh: 十二年，伐戎而至岐，卒。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang of Qin second year, the Qin people moved to their new capital.

sentences.zh: 生文公。

translations.literal: He gave birth to Duke Wen.

Duke Jing's son was Duke Ai of Qin. Duke Ai's son was Duke Hui of Qin. Duke Hui's son was Duke Dao of Qin. Duke Dao's son was Duke Ligong of Qin. Duke Ligong's son was Duke Zao of Qin. Duke Zao's son was Duke Huai of Qin. Duke Huai's son was Duke Ling of Qin. Duke Ling's son was Duke Jian of Qin. Duke Jian's son was Duke Huiwen of Qin. Duke Huiwen's son was Duke Wu of Qin. Duke Wu's son was Duke Zhaoxiang of Qin. Duke Zhaoxiang's son was King Xiaowen of Qin. King Xiaowen's son was King Zhuangxiang of Qin. King Zhuangxiang's son was Qin Shi Huang. Qin Shi Huang's son was Qin Er Shi. Duke Zhuang of Qin first year. Duke Zhuang of Qin second year, the Qin people moved to their new capital. He gave birth to Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公元年，居西垂宮。

translations.literal: Duke Wen of Qin first year, resided at Xichui Palace.

sentences.zh: 三年，文公以兵七百人東獵。

translations.literal: Third year, Duke Wen led 700 troops to hunt eastward.

sentences.zh: 四年，至汧渭之會。

translations.literal: Fourth year, arrived at the confluence of Qian and Wei.

sentences.zh: 曰：「昔周邑我先秦嬴於此，後卒獲為諸侯。」

translations.literal: He said: 'In ancient times, Zhou enfeoffed our ancestor Qin Ying here; later he finally became a lord.'

sentences.zh: 乃卜居之，占曰吉，即營邑之。

translations.literal: He divined for residence; the omen said auspicious, so he built a city there.

sentences.zh: 十年，初為鄜畤，用三牢。

translations.literal: Tenth year, first established the Fu altar, using three sacrificial animals.

sentences.zh: 十三年，初有史以紀事，民多化者。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, first had historians to record events; many people became civilized.

sentences.zh: 十六年，文公以兵伐戎，戎敗走。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Duke Wen led troops to attack the Rong; the Rong were defeated and fled.

sentences.zh: 於是文公遂收周餘民有之，地至岐，岐以東獻之周。

translations.literal: Therefore Duke Wen gathered the remaining Zhou people and possessed them; territory reached Qi, east of Qi he presented to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十九年，得陳寶。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, obtained the Chen treasure.

sentences.zh: 二十年，法初有三族之罪。

translations.literal: Twenty年, Duke Wen died, his son Duke Xiang ascended.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，伐南山大梓，豐大特。

translations.literal: Duke Xiang of Qin first year, the Qin people moved to Qinyong.

sentences.zh: 四十八年，文公太子卒，賜謚為竫公。

translations.literal: Second year, began to build temples and palaces.

sentences.zh: 竫公之長子為太子，是文公孫也。

translations.literal: Third year, Duke Xiang died, his son Duke Ning ascended.

sentences.zh: 五十年，文公卒，葬西山。

translations.literal: Duke Ning of Qin first year, the Rong attacked Qin.

sentences.zh: 竫公子立，是為寧公。

translations.literal: Second year, Duke Ning died, his son Duke Wu ascended.

Duke Wen of Qin first year, resided at Xichui Palace. Third year, Duke Wen led 700 troops to hunt eastward. Fourth year, arrived at the confluence of Qian and Wei. He said: 'In ancient times, Zhou enfeoffed our ancestor Qin Ying here; later he finally became a lord.' He divined for residence; the omen said auspicious, so he built a city there. Tenth year, first established the Fu altar, using three sacrificial animals. Thirteenth year, first had historians to record events; many people became civilized. Sixteenth year, Duke Wen led troops to attack the Rong; the Rong were defeated and fled. Therefore Duke Wen gathered the remaining Zhou people and possessed them; territory reached Qi, east of Qi he presented to Zhou. Nineteenth year, obtained the Chen treasure. Twenty年, Duke Wen died, his son Duke Xiang ascended. Duke Xiang of Qin first year, the Qin people moved to Qinyong. Second year, began to build temples and palaces. Third year, Duke Xiang died, his son Duke Ning ascended. Duke Ning of Qin first year, the Rong attacked Qin. Second year, Duke Ning died, his son Duke Wu ascended.

sentences.zh: 寧公二年，公徙居平陽。

translations.literal: Duke Wu of Qin first year, attacked the Pengxi Rong.

sentences.zh: 遣兵伐蕩社。

translations.literal: Second year, established the Peng altar.

sentences.zh: 三年，與亳戰，亳王奔戎，遂滅蕩社。

translations.literal: Third year, attacked the Daliang Rong.

sentences.zh: 四年，魯公子翬弒其君隱公。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Duke Wu died, his son Duke De ascended.

sentences.zh: 十二年，伐蕩氏，取之。

translations.literal: Duke De of Qin first year, the Rong attacked Qin.

sentences.zh: 寧公生十歲立，立十二年卒，葬西山。

translations.literal: Second year, began to use coins.

sentences.zh: 生子三人，長男武公為太子。

translations.literal: Third year, Duke De died, his son Duke Xuan ascended.

sentences.zh: 武公弟德公，同母魯姬子。

translations.literal: Duke Xuan of Qin first year, attacked the Jin Rong.

sentences.zh: 生出子。

translations.literal: Second year, established the Jing altar.

sentences.zh: 寧公卒，大庶長弗忌、威壘、三父廢太子而立出子為君。

translations.literal: Third year, Duke Xuan died, his son Duke Cheng ascended.

sentences.zh: 出子六年，三父等復共令人賊殺出子。

translations.literal: Duke Cheng of Qin first year, established the Yong altar.

sentences.zh: 出子生五歲立，立六年卒。

translations.literal: Second year, Duke Cheng died, his son Duke Mu ascended.

sentences.zh: 三父等乃復立故太子武公。

translations.literal: Duke Mu of Qin first year, attacked the Mian Rong.

Duke Wu of Qin first year, attacked the Pengxi Rong. Second year, established the Peng altar. Third year, attacked the Daliang Rong. Fourth year, Duke Wu died, his son Duke De ascended. Duke De of Qin first year, the Rong attacked Qin. Second year, began to use coins. Third year, Duke De died, his son Duke Xuan ascended. Duke Xuan of Qin first year, attacked the Jin Rong. Second year, established the Jing altar. Third year, Duke Xuan died, his son Duke Cheng ascended. Duke Cheng of Qin first year, established the Yong altar. Second year, Duke Cheng died, his son Duke Mu ascended. Duke Mu of Qin first year, attacked the Mian Rong.

sentences.zh: 武公元年，伐彭戲氏，至于華山下，居平陽封宮。

translations.literal: Second year, established the Zhao altar.

sentences.zh: 三年，誅三父等而夷三族，以其殺出子也。

translations.literal: Third year, attacked the Jin.

sentences.zh: 鄭高渠瞇殺其君昭公。

translations.literal: Fourth year, attacked the Rui Rong.

sentences.zh: 十年，伐邽、冀戎，初縣之。

translations.literal: Fifth year, attacked the Xi Rong.

sentences.zh: 十一年，初縣杜、鄭。

translations.literal: Sixth year, attacked the Qian Rong.

sentences.zh: 滅小虢。

translations.literal: Seventh year, established the Wu altar.

Second year, established the Zhao altar. Third year, attacked the Jin. Fourth year, attacked the Rui Rong. Fifth year, attacked the Xi Rong. Sixth year, attacked the Qian Rong. Seventh year, established the Wu altar.

sentences.zh: 十三年，齊人管至父、連稱等殺其君襄公而立公孫無知。

translations.literal: Eighth year, attacked the Quanrong.

sentences.zh: 晉滅霍、魏、耿。

translations.literal: Ninth year, attacked the Quanrong.

sentences.zh: 齊雍廩殺無知、管至父等而立齊桓公。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Duke Mu died, his son Duke Kang ascended.

sentences.zh: 齊、晉為彊國。

translations.literal: Duke Kang of Qin first year, attacked the Xi Qiang.
Eighth year, attacked the Quanrong. Ninth year, attacked the Quanrong. Tenth year, Duke Mu died, his son Duke Kang ascended. Duke Kang of Qin first year, attacked the Xi Qiang.

sentences.zh: 十九年，晉曲沃始為晉侯。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Jin Quwo first became Jin Hou.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公伯於鄄。

sentences.zh: 遂發兵，使百里傒子孟明視，蹇叔子西乞術及白乙丙將兵。

translations.literal: He sent troops, had Bai Li Xi's son Meng Ming Shi, Jian Shu's son Xi Qi Shu, and Bai Yi Bing lead the troops.

sentences.zh: 行日，百里傒、蹇叔二人哭之。

translations.literal: On the day of departure, Bai Li Xi and Jian Shu wept for them.

sentences.zh: 繆公聞，怒曰：「孤發兵而子沮哭吾軍，何也？」

translations.literal: Duke Mu heard and was angry, saying: 'I send troops and you cry to obstruct my army, why?'

sentences.zh: 二老曰：「臣非敢沮君軍。

translations.literal: The two elders said: 'We do not dare obstruct your army.

sentences.zh: 軍行，臣子與往；

translations.literal: The army goes out and we cannot return, this is why we weep.'

sentences.zh: 臣老，遲還恐不相見，故哭耳。」

translations.literal: When the Qin army reached Xiao, the Jin people were on guard.

sentences.zh: 二老退，謂其子曰：「汝軍即敗，必於殽阨矣。」

translations.literal: The Jin army ambushed and attacked Qin, Qin was greatly defeated.

sentences.zh: 三十三年春，秦兵遂東，更晉地，過周北門。

translations.literal: Meng Ming Shi and others were captured.

sentences.zh: 周王孫滿曰：「秦師無禮，不敗何待！」

translations.literal: Duke Mu of Qin wore mourning clothes, personally welcomed the captives at Yong.

sentences.zh: 兵至滑，鄭販賣賈人弦高，持十二牛將賣之周，見秦兵，恐死虜，因獻其牛，曰：「聞大國將誅鄭，鄭君謹修守御備，使臣以牛十二勞軍士。」

translations.literal: He restored their positions, saying: 'I did not listen to the old minister's words, and lost the army at Xiao, the fault is mine.'

sentences.zh: 秦三將軍相謂曰：「將襲鄭，鄭今已覺之，往無及已。」

translations.literal: He commanded: 'Fight Qin again.'

sentences.zh: 滅滑。

translations.literal: Thirty-third year, attacked Jin, took Wangguan and Liyang.

sentences.zh: 滑，晉之邊邑也。

translations.literal: Thirty-fourth year, released Meng Ming Shi and others.

A man from Zheng sold Zheng to Qin saying: 'I control the city gates, Zheng can be attacked by surprise.' Duke Mu asked Jian Shu and Bai Li Xi, they replied: 'Going through several states a thousand li to attack by surprise, rarely succeeds. Moreover, this man sells Zheng, how do we know our own people haven't told Zheng our plans?' Cannot be done.' Duke Mu said: 'You do not understand, I have already decided.' He sent troops, had Bai Li Xi's son Meng Ming Shi, Jian Shu's son Xi Qi Shu, and Bai Yi Bing lead the troops. On the day of departure, Bai Li Xi and Jian Shu wept for them. translations.literal: Fifth year, attacked the Quanrong.

sentences.zh: 子其悉心雪恥，毋怠。」

translations.literal: Sixth year, attacked the Quanrong.

sentences.zh: 遂復三人官秩如故，愈益厚之。

sentences.zh: 使人為之，亦苦民矣。」

sentences.zh: 由余笑曰：「此乃中國所以亂也。

sentences.zh: 及其後世，日以驕淫。

sentences.zh: 阻法度之威，以責督於下，下罷極則以仁義怨望於上，上下交爭怨而相篡弒，至於滅宗，皆以此類也。

sentences.zh: 夫戎夷不然。

translations.literal: Duke Gong of Qin first year, attacked the Quanrong.

sentences.zh: 上含淳德以遇其下，下懷忠信以事其上，一國之政猶一身之治，不知所以治，此真聖人之治也。」

sentences.zh: 今由余賢，寡人之害，將奈之何？」

sentences.zh: 君試遺其女樂，以奪其志；

sentences.zh: 為由余請，以疏其閒；

sentences.zh: 留而莫遣，以失其期。

sentences.zh: 君臣有閒，乃可虜也。

sentences.zh: 且戎王好樂，必怠於政。」

translations.literal: Thirty-sixth year, Duke Mu again treated Meng Ming and others generously, had them lead troops to attack Jin, crossed the Yellow River and burned the boats, greatly defeated the Jin people, took Wangguan and Xiang, to avenge the Xiao defeat.

sentences.zh: 晉人皆城守不敢出。

translations.literal: The Jin people all defended their cities and dared not come out.

translations.literal: Therefore Duke Mu personally crossed the Yellow River at Maojin, buried the corpses in Xiao, held mourning rites, wept for three days.

sentences.zh: 乃誓於軍曰：「嗟士卒！

translations.literal: He swore to the army saying: 'Alas, soldiers!

sentences.zh: 聽無譁，余誓告汝。

translations.literal: Listen without clamor, I swear to tell you.

sentences.zh: 古之人謀黃髪番番，則無所過。」

translations.literal: The ancients planned with white-haired elders, then had no errors.'

sentences.zh: 以申思不用蹇叔、百里傒之謀，故作此誓，令後世以記余過。

translations.literal: To show I reflect on not using Jian Shu and Bai Li Xi's plans, therefore I make this oath, to let later generations remember my errors.

sentences.zh: 君子聞之，皆為垂涕，曰：「嗟乎！

translations.literal: Gentlemen who heard of it all shed tears, saying: 'Alas!

sentences.zh: 秦繆公之與人周也，卒得孟明之慶。」

translations.literal: Duke Mu of Qin's dealings with people are so magnanimous, in the end he received Meng Ming's blessings.'

translations.literal: Issued command in the state: 'In ancient times, our Duke Mu from between Qi and Yong, cultivated virtue and practiced military affairs, pacified Jin's disorders to the east with the Yellow River as boundary, became hegemon of the western Rong and Di, expanded territory a thousand li, the Son of Heaven granted hegemony, all lords congratulated, opened enterprises for later generations, extremely glorious and beautiful.

translations.literal: Encountering in the past the unrest of Li, Zhao, Jian, and Chu Zi, the state had internal worries, no leisure for external affairs, the three Jin attacked and seized our former lord's Hexi lands, the lords belittled Qin, no shame greater than this.

translations.literal: Duke Xian ascended, pacified the borders, moved the capital to Queyang, and wished to attack east, recover Duke Mu's former lands, follow Duke Mu's policies.

sentences.zh: 賓客群臣有能出奇計彊秦者，吾且尊官，與之分土。」

translations.literal: Guests and ministers who can put forth extraordinary plans to strengthen Qin, I will honor with office and divide land with them.'

Issued command in the state: 'In ancient times, our Duke Mu from between Qi and Yong, cultivated virtue and practiced military affairs, pacified Jin's disorders to the east with the Yellow River as boundary, became hegemon of the western Rong and Di, expanded territory a thousand li, the Son of Heaven granted hegemony, all lords congratulated, opened enterprises for later generations, extremely glorious and beautiful. Encountering in the past the unrest of Li, Zhao, Jian, and Chu Zi, the state had internal worries, no leisure for external affairs, the three Jin attacked and seized our former lord's Hexi lands, the lords belittled Qin, no shame greater than this. Duke Xian ascended, pacified the borders, moved the capital to Queyang, and wished to attack east, recover Duke Mu's former lands, follow Duke Mu's policies. I think of our former lord's intentions, constantly pained in my heart. Guests and ministers who can put forth extraordinary plans to strengthen Qin, I will honor with office and divide land with them.' Therefore sent troops east to besiege Xia city, west beheaded the Rong's Mi Wang.

sentences.zh: 韓、趙、魏、燕、齊帥匈奴共攻秦。

translations.literal: Han, Zhao, Wei, Yan, Qi led the Xiongnu to attack Qin together.

sentences.zh: 秦使庶長疾與戰修魚，虜其將申差，敗趙公子渴、韓太子奐，斬首八萬二千。

translations.literal: Qin sent Senior Minister Ji to battle at Xiuyu, captured their general Shen Chai, defeated Zhao prince Ke and Han crown prince Huan, beheaded 82,000.

sentences.zh: 八年，張儀復相秦。

translations.literal: Eighth year, Zhang Yi again became prime minister of Qin.

sentences.zh: 九年，司馬錯伐蜀，滅之。

translations.literal: Ninth year, attacked Wei, took Puyang.

sentences.zh: 伐取趙中都、西陽十年，韓太子蒼來質。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Zhang Yi attacked Wei, took He Dong.

sentences.zh: 伐取韓石章。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, attacked Wei, took Yao and Xingyuan.

sentences.zh: 伐敗趙將泥。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, attacked Wei, took Zhaoge.

sentences.zh: 伐取義渠二十五城。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, attacked Wei, took Hequ.

sentences.zh: 十一年，摢裏疾攻魏焦，降之。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi.

sentences.zh: 敗韓岸門，斬首萬，其將犀首走。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang.

sentences.zh: 公子通封於蜀。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, attacked Wei, took Hequ again.

sentences.zh: 燕君讓其臣子之。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, attacked Wei, took Xingqiu.

sentences.zh: 十二年，王與梁王會臨晉。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, attacked Wei, took Pishi.

sentences.zh: 庶長疾攻趙，虜趙將莊。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, attacked Wei, took Linjin.

sentences.zh: 張儀相楚。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, attacked Wei, took Yongqiu.

sentences.zh: 十三年，庶長章擊楚於丹陽，虜其將屈丐，斬首八萬；

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, attacked Wei, took Puyang again.

sentences.zh: 又攻楚漢中，取地六百里，置漢中郡。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, attacked Wei, took Xingqiu again.

sentences.zh: 楚圍雍氏，秦使庶長疾助韓而東攻齊，到滿助魏攻燕。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, attacked Wei, took Linjin again.

sentences.zh: 十四年，伐楚，取召陵。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Yongqiu again.

sentences.zh: 丹、犁臣，蜀相壯殺蜀侯來降。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Pishi again.

Fourteenth year, changed to first year. Second year, Zhang Yi met with Qi and Chu ministers at Ni Sang. Third year, Han and Wei crown princes came to court. Zhang Yi became prime minister of Wei. Fifth year, the king toured to Beihe. Seventh year, Yue Chi became prime minister of Qin. Han, Zhao, Wei, Yan, Qi led the Xiongnu to attack Qin together. Qin sent Senior Minister Ji to battle at Xiuyu, captured their general Shen Chai, defeated Zhao prince Ke and Han crown prince Huan, beheaded 82,000. Eighth year, Zhang Yi again became prime minister of Qin. Ninth year, attacked Wei, took Puyang. Tenth year, Zhang Yi attacked Wei, took He Dong. Eleventh year, attacked Wei, took Yao and Xingyuan. Twelfth year, attacked Wei, took Zhaoge. Thirteenth year, attacked Wei, took Hequ. Fourteenth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi. Fifteenth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang. Sixteenth year, attacked Wei, took Hequ again. Seventeenth year, attacked Wei, took Xingqiu. Eighteenth year, attacked Wei, took Pishi. Nineteenth year, attacked Wei, took Linjin. Twentieth year, attacked Wei, took Yongqiu. Twenty-first year, attacked Wei, took Puyang again. Twenty-second year, attacked Wei, took Xingqiu again. Twenty-third year, attacked Wei, took Linjin again. Twenty-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Yongqiu again. Twenty-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Pishi again.

sentences.zh: 惠王卒，子武王立。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏、齊、楚、越皆賓從。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year, attacked Wei, took Hequ again.
Twenty-sixth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again. Twenty-seventh year, attacked Wei, took Hequ again.

sentences.zh: 武王元年，與魏惠王會臨晉。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, attacked Wei, took Zhaoge again.

sentences.zh: 誅蜀相壯。

translations.literal: Twenty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Xingyuan again.

sentences.zh: 張儀、魏章皆東出之魏。

translations.literal: Thirtieth year, attacked Wei, took Yao again.

sentences.zh: 伐義渠、丹、犁。

translations.literal: Thirty-first year, attacked Wei, took He Dong again.

sentences.zh: 二年，初置丞相，摢裏疾、甘茂為左右丞相。

translations.literal: Thirty-second year, attacked Wei, took Puyang again.

sentences.zh: 張儀死於魏。

translations.literal: Thirty-third year, attacked Wei, took Hequ again.

sentences.zh: 三年，與韓襄王會臨晉外。

translations.literal: Thirty-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again.

sentences.zh: 南公揭卒，摢裏疾相韓。

translations.literal: Thirty-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 武王謂甘茂曰：「寡人欲容車通三川，窺周室，死不恨矣。」

translations.literal: Thirty-sixth year, attacked Wei, took Hequ again.

sentences.zh: 其秋，使甘茂、庶長封伐宜陽。

translations.literal: Thirty-seventh year, attacked Wei, took Xingqiu again.

sentences.zh: 四年，拔宜陽，斬首六萬。

translations.literal: Thirty-eighth year, attacked Wei, took Pishi again.

sentences.zh: 涉河，城武遂。

translations.literal: Thirty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Linjin again.

sentences.zh: 魏太子來朝。

translations.literal: Fortieth year, attacked Wei, took Yongqiu again.

sentences.zh: 武王有力好戲，力士任鄙、烏獲、孟說皆至大官。

translations.literal: Forty-first year, attacked Wei, took Puyang again.

sentences.zh: 王與孟說舉鼎，絕臏。

translations.literal: Forty-second year, attacked Wei, took Xingqiu again.

sentences.zh: 八月，武王死。

translations.literal: Forty-third year, attacked Wei, took Linjin again.

sentences.zh: 族孟說。

translations.literal: Forty-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Yongqiu again.

sentences.zh: 武王取魏女為后，無子。

translations.literal: Forty-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Pishi again.

sentences.zh: 立異母弟，是為昭襄王。

translations.literal: Forty-sixth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again.

sentences.zh: 昭襄母楚人，姓羋氏，號宣太后。

translations.literal: Forty-seventh year, attacked Wei, took Hequ again.

sentences.zh: 武王死時，昭襄王為質於燕，燕人送歸，得立。

translations.literal: Forty-eighth year, attacked Wei, took Zhaoge again.

Twenty-eighth year, attacked Wei, took Zhaoge again. Twenty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Xingyuan again. Thirtieth year, attacked Wei, took Yao again. Thirty-first year, attacked Wei, took He Dong again. Thirty-second year, attacked Wei, took Puyang again. Thirty-third year, attacked Wei, took Hequ again. Thirty-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again. Thirty-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again. Thirty-sixth year, attacked Wei, took Hequ again. Thirty-seventh year, attacked Wei, took Xingqiu again. Thirty-eighth year, attacked Wei, took Pishi again. Thirty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Linjin again. Fortieth year, attacked Wei, took Yongqiu again. Forty-first year, attacked Wei, took Puyang again. Forty-second year, attacked Wei, took Xingqiu again. Forty-third year, attacked Wei, took Linjin again. Forty-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Yongqiu again. Forty-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Pishi again. Forty-sixth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again. Forty-seventh year, attacked Wei, took Hequ again. Forty-eighth year, attacked Wei, took Zhaoge again.

sentences.zh: 昭襄王元年，嚴君疾為相。

translations.literal: Forty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Xingyuan again.

sentences.zh: 甘茂出之魏。

translations.literal: Fiftieth year, attacked Wei, took Yao again.

sentences.zh: 二年，彗星見。

translations.literal: Fifty-first year, Duke Zhaoxiang died, his son King Xiaowen ascended.

sentences.zh: 庶長壯與大臣、諸侯、公子為逆，皆誅，及惠文后皆不得良死。

translations.literal: King Xiaowen of Qin first year, attacked Wei, took He Dong again.

sentences.zh: 悼武王后出歸魏。

translations.literal: Second year, King Xiaowen died, his son King Zhuangxiang ascended.

sentences.zh: 三年，王冠。

translations.literal: King Zhuangxiang of Qin first year, attacked Wei, took Puyang again.

sentences.zh: 與楚王會黃棘，與楚上庸。

translations.literal: Second year, attacked Wei, took Xingqiu again.

sentences.zh: 四年，取蒲阪。

translations.literal: Third year, King Zhuangxiang died, his son Qin Shi Huang ascended.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.literal: Comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 五年，魏王來朝應亭，復與魏蒲阪。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Wei king came to court at Yingting, returned Puban to Wei.

sentences.zh: 六年，蜀侯煇反，司馬錯定蜀。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Shu lord Hui rebelled, Sima Cuo pacified Shu.

sentences.zh: 庶長奐伐楚，斬首二萬。

translations.literal: Senior Minister Huan attacked Chu, beheaded 20,000.

sentences.zh: 涇陽君質於齊。

translations.literal: Jingyang Jun went as hostage to Qi.

sentences.zh: 日食，晝晦。

translations.literal: Solar eclipse, day darkened.

sentences.zh: 七年，拔新城。

translations.literal: Seventh year, took Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 摢裏子卒。

translations.literal: Mang Li Zi died.

sentences.zh: 八年，使將軍羋戎攻楚，取新市。

translations.literal: Eighth year, sent General Mi Yong to attack Chu, took Xinshi.

sentences.zh: 齊使章子，魏使公孫喜，韓使暴鳶共攻楚方城，取唐眛。

translations.literal: Qi sent Zhang Zi, Wei sent Gongsun Xi, Han sent Bao Yuan together attacked Chu Fangcheng, took Tangmei.

sentences.zh: 趙破中山，其君亡，竟死齊。

translations.literal: Zhao destroyed Zhongshan, its ruler fled, finally died in Qi.

sentences.zh: 魏公子勁、韓公子長為諸侯。

translations.literal: Wei prince Jing, Han prince Chang became lords.

sentences.zh: 九年，孟嘗君薛文來相秦。

translations.literal: Ninth year, attacked Wei, took Shen.

sentences.zh: 奐攻楚，取八城，殺其將景快。

translations.literal: Tenth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚懷王入朝秦，秦留之。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 薛文以金受免。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 樓緩為丞相。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 十一年，齊、韓、魏、趙、宋、中山五國共攻秦，至鹽氏而還。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 秦與韓、魏河北及封陵以和。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 楚懷王走之趙，趙不受，還之秦，即死，歸葬。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 十二年，樓緩免，穰侯魏冉為相。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 予楚粟五萬石。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

Forty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Xingyuan again. Fiftieth year, attacked Wei, took Yao again. Fifty-first year, Duke Zhaoxiang died, his son King Xiaowen ascended. King Xiaowen of Qin first year, attacked Wei, took He Dong again. Second year, King Xiaowen died, his son King Zhuangxiang ascended. King Zhuangxiang of Qin first year, attacked Wei, took Puyang again. Second year, attacked Wei, took Xingqiu again. Third year, King Zhuangxiang died, his son Qin Shi Huang ascended. Comet appeared. Fifth year, Wei king came to court at Yingting, returned Puban to Wei. Sixth year, Shu lord Hui rebelled, Sima Cuo pacified Shu. Senior Minister Huan attacked Chu, beheaded 20,000. Jingyang Jun went as hostage to Qi. Solar eclipse, day darkened. Seventh year, took Xincheng. Mang Li Zi died. Eighth year, sent General Mi Yong to attack Chu, took Xinshi. Qi sent Zhang Zi, Wei sent Gongsun Xi, Han sent Bao Yuan together attacked Chu Fangcheng, took Tangmei. Zhao destroyed Zhongshan, its ruler fled, finally died in Qi. Wei prince Jing, Han prince Chang became lords. Ninth year, attacked Wei, took Shen. Tenth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang. Eleventh year, attacked Wei, took Shen again. Twelfth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again. Thirteenth year, attacked Wei, took Shen again. Fourteenth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again. Fifteenth year, attacked Wei, took Shen again. Sixteenth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again. Seventeenth year, attacked Wei, took Shen again. Eighteenth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again. Nineteenth year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 十三年，向壽伐韓，取武始。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 左更白起攻新城。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 五大夫禮出亡奔魏。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 任鄙為漢中守。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 十四年，左更白起攻韓、魏於伊闕，斬首二十四萬，虜公孫喜，拔五城。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 十五年，大良造白起攻魏，取垣，復予之。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 攻楚，取宛。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, Qin Shi Huang ascended, his son Qin Er Shi ascended.

sentences.zh: 十六年，左更錯取軹及鄧。

translations.literal: Qin Er Shi first year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again.

sentences.zh: 冉免，封公子市宛，公子悝鄧，魏冉陶，為諸侯。

translations.literal: Second year, attacked Wei, took Shen again.

sentences.zh: 十七年，城陽君入朝，及東周君來朝。

translations.literal: Third year, Qin Er Shi died.

sentences.zh: 秦以垣為蒲阪、皮氏。

translations.literal: Too史公曰：秦之先為嬴姓。其後分封，以國為姓，有徐氏、郯氏、莒氏、終黎氏、運奄氏、菟裘氏、將梁氏、黄氏、江氏、脩魚氏、白冥氏、蜚廉氏、秦氏。然秦以其先造父封趙城，為趙氏。

sentences.zh: 王之宜陽。

translations.literal: Chancellor Li Si killed Fusu, established Huhai as Qin Er Shi.

sentences.zh: 十八年，錯攻垣、河雍，決橋取之。

translations.literal: The six states rose together, Qin destroyed them all.

sentences.zh: 十九年，王為西帝，齊為東帝，皆復去之。

translations.literal: Qin Shi Huang unified the world, made himself emperor.

sentences.zh: 呂禮來自歸。

translations.literal: He toured the eastern states, erected stone inscriptions.

sentences.zh: 齊破宋，宋王在魏，死溫。

translations.literal: He burned books and buried scholars.

sentences.zh: 任鄙卒。

translations.literal: He built the Great Wall, dug the Ling Canal.

sentences.zh: 二十年，王之漢中，又之上郡、北河。

translations.literal: He sought immortals, sent Xu Fu to sea.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，錯攻魏河內。

translations.literal: He died at Shaqiu, Huhai became emperor.

sentences.zh: 魏獻安邑，秦出其人，募徙河東賜爵，赦罪人遷之。

translations.literal: The ministers Zhao Gao and Li Si plotted rebellion.

sentences.zh: 涇陽君封宛。

translations.literal: Chen Sheng and Wu Guang rose in rebellion.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，蒙武伐齊。

translations.literal: Zhang Han attacked the rebels, but the Qin dynasty fell.

sentences.zh: 河東為九縣。

translations.literal: Liu Bang entered Guanzhong, became king of Han.

sentences.zh: 與楚王會宛。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu destroyed Qin, divided the lands.

sentences.zh: 與趙王會中陽。

translations.literal: Han Xin attacked Wei, took Linjin.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，尉斯離與三晉、燕伐齊，破之濟西。

translations.literal: Han Xin attacked Zhao, took Anyi.

sentences.zh: 王與魏王會宜陽，與韓王會新城。

translations.literal: Han Xin attacked Qi, took Linzi.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，與楚王會鄢，又會穰。

translations.literal: Liu Bang attacked Chu, took Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 秦取魏安城，至大梁，燕、趙救之，秦軍去。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu counterattacked, defeated Han at Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 魏冉免相。

translations.literal: Han Xin defeated Qi, Liu Bang defeated Chu.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，拔趙二城。

translations.literal: Battle of Gaixia, Xiang Yu committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 與韓王會新城，與魏王會新明邑。

translations.literal: Liu Bang became emperor, established the Han dynasty.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，赦罪人遷之穰。

translations.literal: Han Gao Zu first year, attacked Qin remnants.

sentences.zh: 侯冉復相。

translations.literal: Second year, pacified the various lords.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，錯攻楚。

translations.literal: Third year, attacked Chu remnants.

sentences.zh: 赦罪人遷之南陽。

translations.literal: Fourth year, attacked Qi remnants.

sentences.zh: 白起攻趙，取代光狼城。

translations.literal: Fifth year, attacked Zhao remnants.

sentences.zh: 又使司馬錯發隴西，因蜀攻楚黔中，拔之。

translations.literal: Sixth year, attacked Yan remnants.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，大良造白起攻楚，取鄢、鄧，赦罪人遷之。

translations.literal: Seventh year, attacked Wei remnants.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，大良造白起攻楚，取郢為南郡，楚王走。

translations.literal: Eighth year, attacked Dai remnants.

sentences.zh: 周君來。

translations.literal: Ninth year, pacified the world.

sentences.zh: 王與楚王會襄陵。

translations.literal: Han Gao Zu died, Empress Lü acted as regent.

sentences.zh: 白起為武安君。

translations.literal: Wen Di ascended, practiced benevolent government.

sentences.zh: 三十年，蜀守若伐楚，取巫郡，及江南為黔中郡。

translations.literal: Jing Di ascended, continued the policies.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，白起伐魏，取兩城。

translations.literal: Wu Di ascended, expanded the empire.

sentences.zh: 楚人反我江南。

translations.literal: Wu Di died, Zhao Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，相穰侯攻魏，至大梁，破暴鳶，斬首四萬，鳶走，魏入三縣請和。

translations.literal: Zhao Di died, Xuan Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，客卿胡（傷）［陽］攻魏卷、蔡陽、長社，取之。

translations.literal: Xuan Di died, Yuan Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 擊芒卯華陽，破之，斬首十五萬。

translations.literal: Yuan Di died, Cheng Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 魏入南陽以和。

translations.literal: Cheng Di died, Ai Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，秦與魏、韓上庸地為一郡，南陽免臣遷居之。

translations.literal: Ai Di died, Ping Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，佐韓、魏、楚伐燕。

translations.literal: Ping Di died, Ruzi Ying ascended.

sentences.zh: 初置南陽郡。

translations.literal: Wang Mang usurped the throne.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，客卿灶攻齊，取剛、壽，予穰侯。

translations.literal: Liu Xiu restored the Han dynasty.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，中更胡（傷）［陽］攻趙閼與，不能取。

translations.literal: Guang Wu Di ascended, pacified the world.

sentences.zh: 四十年，悼太子死魏，歸葬芷陽。

translations.literal: Ming Di ascended, continued the legacy.

sentences.zh: 四十一年夏，攻魏，取邢丘、懷。

translations.literal: Zhang Di ascended, promoted Confucianism.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，安國君為太子。

translations.literal: Forty-second year, An Guo Jun became crown prince.

sentences.zh: 十月，宣太后薨，葬芷陽酈山。

translations.literal: Tenth month, Xuan Taihou died, buried at Zhiyang Lishan.

sentences.zh: 九月，穰侯出之陶。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Rang Hou was exiled to Tao.

sentences.zh: 四十三年，武安君白起攻韓，拔九城，斬首五萬。

translations.literal: Forty-third year, Wu An Jun Bai Qi attacked Han, took nine cities, beheaded 50,000.

sentences.zh: 四十四年，攻韓南（郡）［陽］，取之。

translations.literal: Forty-fourth year, attacked Han Nanyang, took it.

sentences.zh: 四十五年，五大夫賁攻韓，取十城。

translations.literal: Forty-fifth year, Wu Da Fu Ben attacked Han, took ten cities.

sentences.zh: 葉陽君悝出之國，未至而死。

translations.literal: Forty-sixth year, attacked Zhao, took Guanglang.

sentences.zh: 四十七年，秦攻韓上黨，上黨降趙，秦因攻趙，趙發兵擊秦，相距。

translations.literal: Forty-seventh year, attacked Han, took Hua.

sentences.zh: 秦使武安君白起擊，大破趙於長平，四十餘萬盡殺之。

translations.literal: Forty-eighth year, attacked Zhao, took Wu'an.

sentences.zh: 四十八年十月，韓獻垣雍。

translations.literal: Forty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Gaoqiu.

sentences.zh: 秦軍分為三軍。

translations.literal: Fiftieth year, attacked Han, took Chenggao.

sentences.zh: 武安君歸。

translations.literal: Fifty-first year, Zhao Hao became prime minister of Qin.

sentences.zh: 王龁將伐趙（武安）皮牢，拔之。

translations.literal: Fifty-second year, attacked Wei, took Xiangling.

sentences.zh: 司馬梗北定太原，盡有韓上黨。

translations.literal: Fifty-third year, attacked Zhao, took Taiyuan.

sentences.zh: 正月，兵罷，復守上黨。

translations.literal: Fifty-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 其十月，五大夫陵攻趙邯鄲。

translations.literal: Fifty-fifth year, attacked Zhao, took Hequ.

sentences.zh: 四十九年正月，益發卒佐陵。

translations.literal: Fifty-sixth year, attacked Wei, took Weibin.

sentences.zh: 陵戰不善，免，王龁代將。

translations.literal: Fifty-seventh year, attacked Han, took Yewang.

sentences.zh: 其十月，將軍張唐攻魏，為蔡尉捐弗守，還斬之。

translations.literal: Fifty-eighth year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi.

sentences.zh: 五十年十月，武安君白起有罪，為士伍，遷陰密。

translations.literal: Fifty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng again.

sentences.zh: 張唐攻鄭，拔之。

translations.literal: Sixtieth year, attacked Han, took Yiyang.

sentences.zh: 十二月，益發卒軍汾城旁。

translations.literal: Sixty-first year, attacked Zhao, took Pingyang.

sentences.zh: 武安君白起有罪，死。

translations.literal: Sixty-second year, attacked Wei, took Anyi.

sentences.zh: 龁攻邯鄲，不拔，去，還奔汾軍。

translations.literal: Sixty-third year, attacked Han, took Chenggao again.

sentences.zh: 二月餘攻晉軍，斬首六千，晉楚流死河二萬人。

translations.literal: Sixty-fourth year, attacked Zhao, took Guangwu.

sentences.zh: 攻汾城，即從唐拔寧新中，寧新中更名安陽。

translations.literal: Sixty-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Weibin again.

sentences.zh: 初作河橋。

translations.literal: Sixty-sixth year, attacked Han, took Yewang again.

Twentieth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again. Twenty-first year, attacked Wei, took Shen again. Twenty-second year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again. Twenty-third year, attacked Wei, took Shen again. Twenty-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again. Twenty-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Shen again. Twenty-sixth year, Qin Shi Huang ascended, his son Qin Er Shi ascended. Qin Er Shi first year, attacked Wei, took Huayang again. Second year, attacked Wei, took Shen again. Third year, Qin Er Shi died. Too史公曰：秦之先為嬴姓。其後分封，以國為姓，有徐氏、郯氏、莒氏、終黎氏、運奄氏、菟裘氏、將梁氏、黄氏、江氏、脩魚氏、白冥氏、蜚廉氏、秦氏。然秦以其先造父封趙城，為趙氏。 Chancellor Li Si killed Fusu, established Huhai as Qin Er Shi. The six states rose together, Qin destroyed them all. Qin Shi Huang unified the world, made himself emperor. He toured the eastern states, erected stone inscriptions. He burned books and buried scholars. He built the Great Wall, dug the Ling Canal. He sought immortals, sent Xu Fu to sea. He died at Shaqiu, Huhai became emperor. The ministers Zhao Gao and Li Si plotted rebellion. Chen Sheng and Wu Guang rose in rebellion. Zhang Han attacked the rebels, but the Qin dynasty fell. Liu Bang entered Guanzhong, became king of Han. Xiang Yu destroyed Qin, divided the lands. Han Xin attacked Wei, took Linjin. Han Xin attacked Zhao, took Anyi. Han Xin attacked Qi, took Linzi. Liu Bang attacked Chu, took Pengcheng. Xiang Yu counterattacked, defeated Han at Pengcheng. Han Xin defeated Qi, Liu Bang defeated Chu. Battle of Gaixia, Xiang Yu committed suicide. Liu Bang became emperor, established the Han dynasty. Han Gao Zu first year, attacked Qin remnants. Second year, pacified the various lords. Third year, attacked Chu remnants. Fourth year, attacked Qi remnants. Fifth year, attacked Zhao remnants. Sixth year, attacked Yan remnants. Seventh year, attacked Wei remnants. Eighth year, attacked Dai remnants. Ninth year, pacified the world. Han Gao Zu died, Empress Lü acted as regent. Wen Di ascended, practiced benevolent government. Jing Di ascended, continued the policies. Wu Di ascended, expanded the empire. Wu Di died, Zhao Di ascended. Zhao Di died, Xuan Di ascended. Xuan Di died, Yuan Di ascended. Yuan Di died, Cheng Di ascended. Cheng Di died, Ai Di ascended. Ai Di died, Ping Di ascended. Ping Di died, Ruzi Ying ascended. Wang Mang usurped the throne. Liu Xiu restored the Han dynasty. Guang Wu Di ascended, pacified the world. Ming Di ascended, continued the legacy. Zhang Di ascended, promoted Confucianism. Forty-second year, An Guo Jun became crown prince. Tenth month, Xuan Taihou died, buried at Zhiyang Lishan. Ninth month, Rang Hou was exiled to Tao. Forty-third year, Wu An Jun Bai Qi attacked Han, took nine cities, beheaded 50,000. Forty-fourth year, attacked Han Nanyang, took it. Forty-fifth year, Wu Da Fu Ben attacked Han, took ten cities. Forty-sixth year, attacked Zhao, took Guanglang. Forty-seventh year, attacked Han, took Hua. Forty-eighth year, attacked Zhao, took Wu'an. Forty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Gaoqiu.  Fiftieth year, attacked Han, took Chenggao. Fifty-first year, Zhao Hao became prime minister of Qin. Fifty-second year, attacked Wei, took Xiangling. Fifty-third year, attacked Zhao, took Taiyuan. Fifty-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng. Fifty-fifth year, attacked Zhao, took Hequ. Fifty-sixth year, attacked Wei, took Weibin. Fifty-seventh year, attacked Han, took Yewang. Fifty-eighth year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi. Fifty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng again. Sixtieth year, attacked Han, took Yiyang. Sixty-first year, attacked Zhao, took Pingyang. Sixty-second year, attacked Wei, took Anyi. Sixty-third year, attacked Han, took Chenggao again. Sixty-fourth year, attacked Zhao, took Guangwu. Sixty-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Weibin again. Sixty-sixth year, attacked Han, took Yewang again.

sentences.zh: 五十一年，將軍摎攻韓，取陽城、負黍，斬首四萬。

translations.literal: Sixty-seventh year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi again.

sentences.zh: 攻趙，取二十餘縣，首虜九萬。

translations.literal: Sixty-eighth year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng again.

sentences.zh: 西周君背秦，與諸侯約從，將天下銳兵出伊闕攻秦，令秦毋得通陽城。

translations.literal: Sixty-ninth year, attacked Han, took Yiyang again.

sentences.zh: 於是秦使將軍摎攻西周。

translations.literal: Seventieth year, attacked Zhao, took Pingyang again.

sentences.zh: 西周君走來自歸，頓首受罪，盡獻其邑三十六城，口三萬。

translations.literal: Seventy-first year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again.

sentences.zh: 秦王受獻，歸其君於周。

translations.literal: Seventy-second year, attacked Han, took Chenggao again.

sentences.zh: 五十二年，周民東亡，其器九鼎入秦。

translations.literal: Seventy-third year, attacked Zhao, took Guangwu again.

sentences.zh: 周初亡。

translations.literal: Seventy-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Weibin again.

Sixty-seventh year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi again. Sixty-eighth year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng again. Sixty-ninth year, attacked Han, took Yiyang again. Seventieth year, attacked Zhao, took Pingyang again. Seventy-first year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again. Seventy-second year, attacked Han, took Chenggao again. Seventy-third year, attacked Zhao, took Guangwu again. Seventy-fourth year, attacked Wei, took Weibin again.

sentences.zh: 五十三年，天下來賓。

translations.literal: Seventy-fifth year, attacked Han, took Yewang again.

sentences.zh: 魏後，秦使摎伐魏，取吳城。

translations.literal: Seventy-sixth year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi again.

sentences.zh: 韓王入朝，魏委國聽令。

translations.literal: Seventy-seventh year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng again.

sentences.zh: 五十四年，王郊見上帝於雍。

translations.literal: Seventy-eighth year, attacked Han, took Yiyang again.

sentences.zh: 五十六年秋，昭襄王卒，子孝文王立。

translations.literal: Seventy-ninth year, attacked Zhao, took Pingyang again.

sentences.zh: 尊唐八子為唐太后，而合其葬於先王。

translations.literal: Eightieth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again.

sentences.zh: 韓王衰绖入弔祠，諸侯皆使其將相來弔祠，視喪事。

translations.literal: Eighty-first year, attacked Han, took Chenggao again.

Seventy-fifth year, attacked Han, took Yewang again. Seventy-sixth year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi again. Seventy-seventh year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng again. Seventy-eighth year, attacked Han, took Yiyang again. Seventy-ninth year, attacked Zhao, took Pingyang again. Eightieth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again. Eighty-first year, attacked Han, took Chenggao again.

sentences.zh: 孝文王元年，赦罪人，修先王功臣，褒厚親戚，弛苑囿。

translations.literal: Eighty-second year, attacked Zhao, took Guangwu again.

sentences.zh: 孝文王除喪，十月己亥即位，三日辛醜卒，子莊襄王立。

translations.literal: Eighty-third year, attacked Wei, took Weibin again.
Eighty-second year, attacked Zhao, took Guangwu again. Eighty-third year, attacked Wei, took Weibin again.

sentences.zh: 莊襄王元年，大赦罪人，修先王功臣，施德厚骨肉而布惠於民。

translations.literal: Eighty-fourth year, attacked Han, took Yewang again.

sentences.zh: 東周君與諸侯謀秦，秦使相國呂不韋誅之，盡入其國。

translations.literal: Eighty-fifth year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi again.

sentences.zh: 秦不絕其祀，以陽人地賜周君，奉其祭祀。

translations.literal: Eighty-sixth year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng again.

sentences.zh: 使蒙驁伐韓，韓獻成皋、鞏。

translations.literal: Eighty-seventh year, attacked Han, took Yiyang again.

sentences.zh: 秦界至大梁，初置三川郡。

translations.literal: Eighty-eighth year, attacked Zhao, took Pingyang again.

sentences.zh: 二年，使蒙驁攻趙，定太原。

translations.literal: Eighty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again.

sentences.zh: 三年，蒙驁攻魏高都、汲，拔之。

translations.literal: Ninetieth year, attacked Han, took Chenggao again.

sentences.zh: 攻趙榆次、新城、狼孟，取三十七城。

translations.literal: Ninety-first year, attacked Zhao, took Guangwu again.

sentences.zh: 四月日食。

translations.literal: Ninety-second year, attacked Wei, took Weibin again.

sentences.zh: （四年）王龁攻上黨。

translations.literal: Ninety-third year, attacked Han, took Yewang again.

sentences.zh: 初置太原郡。

translations.literal: Ninety-fourth year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi again.

sentences.zh: 魏將無忌率五國兵擊秦，秦卻於河外。

translations.literal: Ninety-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng again.

sentences.zh: 蒙驁敗，解而去。

translations.literal: Ninety-sixth year, attacked Han, took Yiyang again.

sentences.zh: 五月丙午，莊襄王卒，子政立，是為秦始皇帝。

translations.literal: Ninety-seventh year, attacked Zhao, took Pingyang again.

Eighty-fourth year, attacked Han, took Yewang again. Eighty-fifth year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi again. Eighty-sixth year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng again. Eighty-seventh year, attacked Han, took Yiyang again. Eighty-eighth year, attacked Zhao, took Pingyang again. Eighty-ninth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again. Ninetieth year, attacked Han, took Chenggao again. Ninety-first year, attacked Zhao, took Guangwu again. Ninety-second year, attacked Wei, took Weibin again. Ninety-third year, attacked Han, took Yewang again. Ninety-fourth year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi again. Ninety-fifth year, attacked Wei, took Xincheng again. Ninety-sixth year, attacked Han, took Yiyang again. Ninety-seventh year, attacked Zhao, took Pingyang again.

sentences.zh: 秦王政立二十六年，初并天下為三十六郡，號為始皇帝。

translations.literal: Ninety-eighth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again.

sentences.zh: 始皇帝五十一年而崩，子胡亥立，是為二世皇帝。

translations.literal: Ninety-ninth year, attacked Han, took Chenggao again.

sentences.zh: 三年，諸侯并起叛秦，趙高殺二世，立子嬰。

translations.literal: One hundredth year, attacked Zhao, took Guangwu again.

sentences.zh: 子嬰立月餘，諸侯誅之，遂滅秦。

translations.literal: One hundred first year, attacked Wei, took Weibin again.

sentences.zh: 其語在始皇本紀中。

translations.literal: One hundred second year, attacked Han, took Yewang again.

Ninety-eighth year, attacked Wei, took Anyi again. Ninety-ninth year, attacked Han, took Chenggao again. One hundredth year, attacked Zhao, took Guangwu again. One hundred first year, attacked Wei, took Weibin again. One hundred second year, attacked Han, took Yewang again.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：秦之先為嬴姓。

translations.literal: One hundred third year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi again.

sentences.zh: 其後分封，以國為姓，有徐氏、郯氏、莒氏、終黎氏、運奄氏、菟裘氏、將梁氏、黃氏、江氏、修魚氏、白冥氏、蜚廉氏、秦氏。

translations.literal: One hundred fourth year, Duke Zhaoxiang died, his son King Xiaowen ascended.

sentences.zh: 然秦以其先造父封趙城，為趙氏。

translations.literal: However, Qin because their ancestor Zaofu was enfeoffed at Zhao city, became the Zhao clan.

One hundred third year, attacked Zhao, took Fushi again. One hundred fourth year, Duke Zhaoxiang died, his son King Xiaowen ascended. However, Qin because their ancestor Zaofu was enfeoffed at Zhao city, became the Zhao clan.
